panels.title: General Counters, CPU, Memory and File Descriptor Stats

panels.description: Average user and system CPU time spent in seconds.
panels.title: Average CPU Usage

panels.description: Virtual and Resident memory size in bytes, averages over 5 min interval
panels.title: Average Memory Usage

targets.expr: pg_stat_activity_count{datname=~"$datname", job="$job", state=~"idle|idle in transaction|idle in transaction (aborted)"}

panels.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: Temp File (Bytes)

targets.legendFormat: write_time - Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk.
sync_time - Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk.

panels.description: Rate of rows(=tuples) fetched and returned by queries.
panels.title: Rows fetched/returned

panels.description: Rate of rows(=tuples) inserted, updated and deleted by queries.
panels.title: Rows inserted/updated/deleted

panels.description:
Current number of connected clients to each datname.

Current number of backends. PostgreSQL creates a backend for each connected client.
panels.title: Active connections

panels.description: Number of transactions that have been committed/rollbacked.
panels.title: Transaction stats

panels.description:
A checkpoint is a point in WAL for which PostgreSQL ensures that all WAL-entries before the checkpoint are applied.

Checkpoints are typically scheduled, but can be manually initiated.
panels.title: Bgwriter checkpoints

panels.description: The rate of how many dirty buffers are written down by a various subsystems: background writer, checkpointer or directly by a backend.
panels.title: Bgwriter buffers
Total time per user per second
